title: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
description: Comprehensive exploration of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), its core functions, implementation tiers, and practical application in organizations.

sections.subtitle: NIST CSF Overview
sections.description: Introduction to the NIST Cybersecurity Framework and its development
points: Voluntary framework developed by NIST in response to Executive Order 13636
Designed to improve critical infrastructure cybersecurity
Technology-neutral and scalable for organizations of all sizes
Regularly updated to address emerging threats and practices

sections.subtitle: Framework Components
sections.description: Understanding the three main components of the NIST CSF
points: Framework Core: Set of cybersecurity activities and outcomes
Implementation Tiers: Context of how an organization views cybersecurity risk
Framework Profiles: Alignment of standards, guidelines, and practices
Integration with existing risk management processes

sections.subtitle: Identify Function
sections.description: Understanding the systems, assets, data, and capabilities
points: Asset Management: Inventory of systems and data
Business Environment: Organization's mission and objectives
Risk Assessment: Understanding cybersecurity risks
Risk Management Strategy: Risk tolerance and priorities

sections.subtitle: Protect Function
sections.description: Implementing safeguards to ensure delivery of services
points: Access Control: Managing identity and authentication
Awareness and Training: Security training programs
Data Security: Protection of information
Protective Technology: Technical security solutions

sections.subtitle: Detect Function
points: Anomalies and Events: Detecting unusual activity
Security Continuous Monitoring: Ongoing security assessment
Detection Processes: Maintaining detection effectiveness
Integration with security tools and systems

sections.subtitle: Respond Function
points: Response Planning: Executing response processes
Communications: Coordination with stakeholders
Analysis: Understanding impact and improving procedures
Mitigation: Preventing expansion of events

sections.subtitle: Recover Function
points: Recovery Planning: Executing recovery processes
Improvements: Incorporating lessons learned
Communications: Coordinating restoration activities
Managing public relations and reputation

sections.subtitle: Implementation Tiers
points: Tier 1 - Partial: Ad-hoc and reactive processes
Tier 2 - Risk Informed: Risk management approved but not organization-wide
Tier 3 - Repeatable: Formal policies and regular updates
Tier 4 - Adaptive: Continuous improvement and adaptation

sections.subtitle: Creating Framework Profiles
points: Assessment of current cybersecurity state
Definition of target cybersecurity state
Gap analysis between current and target states
Action plan development and prioritization

quiz.title: NIST CSF Mastery Check
quiz.description: Test your understanding of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework

questions.question: Which NIST CSF core function focuses on developing and implementing appropriate safeguards?
questions.explanation: The Protect function focuses on developing and implementing appropriate safeguards to ensure delivery of critical infrastructure services.

questions.question: What characterizes a Tier 4 (Adaptive) implementation in the NIST CSF?
questions.explanation: Tier 4 (Adaptive) represents the most mature implementation, characterized by continuous improvement and real-time adaptation to emerging threats and changes in the environment.

questions.question: Which component of the NIST CSF helps organizations align their security practices with business requirements?
questions.explanation: Framework Profiles help organizations align their cybersecurity activities with their business requirements, risk tolerance, and resources.
